return_description: A UnicodeDecodingResult instance, representing the next Unicode scalar, an indication of an error, or an indication that the UTF sequence has been fully decoded.

params.param_description: An iterator of code units to be decoded. input must be the same iterator instance in repeated calls to this method. Do not advance the iterator or any copies of the iterator outside this method.

Methods.method_description: Starts or continues decoding a UTF-16 sequence.
Methods.method_declar: mutating func decode<I>(_ input: inout I) -> UnicodeDecodingResult where I : IteratorProtocol, I.Element == Unicode.UTF16.CodeUnit
static func decode(_ source: Unicode.UTF16.EncodedScalar) -> Unicode.Scalar
static func encode(_ source: Unicode.Scalar) -> Unicode.UTF16.EncodedScalar?

params.param_description: The Unicode scalar value to encode.
A closure that processes one code unit argument at a time.

Methods.method_description: Encodes a Unicode scalar as a series of code units by calling the given closure on each code unit.
Methods.method_declar: static func encode(_ input: Unicode.Scalar, into processCodeUnit: (Unicode.UTF16.CodeUnit) -> Void)

return_description: true if x is a high-surrogate code unit; otherwise, false.

Methods.method_description: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the specified code unit is a high-surrogate code unit.
Methods.method_declar: static func isLeadSurrogate(_ x: Unicode.UTF16.CodeUnit) -> Bool

return_description: true if x is a low-surrogate code unit; otherwise, false.

Methods.method_description: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the specified code unit is a low-surrogate code unit.
Methods.method_declar: static func isTrailSurrogate(_ x: Unicode.UTF16.CodeUnit) -> Bool

return_description: The leading surrogate code unit of x when encoded in UTF-16.

params.param_description: A Unicode scalar value. x must be represented by a surrogate pair when encoded in UTF-16. To check whether x is represented by a surrogate pair, use UTF16.width(x) == 2.

Methods.method_description: Returns the high-surrogate code unit of the surrogate pair representing the specified Unicode scalar.
Methods.method_declar: static func leadSurrogate(_ x: Unicode.Scalar) -> UTF16.CodeUnit

return_description: The trailing surrogate code unit of x when encoded in UTF-16.

params.param_description: A Unicode scalar value. x must be represented by a surrogate pair when encoded in UTF-16. To check whether x is represented by a surrogate pair, use UTF16.width(x) == 2.

Methods.method_description: Returns the low-surrogate code unit of the surrogate pair representing the specified Unicode scalar.
Methods.method_declar: static func trailSurrogate(_ x: Unicode.Scalar) -> UTF16.CodeUnit
static func transcode<FromEncoding>(_ content: FromEncoding.EncodedScalar, from _: FromEncoding.Type) -> Unicode.UTF16.EncodedScalar? where FromEncoding : _UnicodeEncoding

return_description: A tuple containing the number of UTF-16 code units required to encode input and a Boolean value that indicates whether the input contained only ASCII characters. If repairingIllFormedSequences is false and an ill-formed sequence is detected, this method returns nil.

params.param_description: An iterator of code units to be translated, encoded as sourceEncoding. If repairingIllFormedSequences is true, the entire iterator will be exhausted. Otherwise, iteration will stop if an ill-formed sequence is detected.

Pass true to measure the length of input even when input contains ill-formed sequences. Each ill-formed sequence is replaced with a Unicode replacement character ("\u{FFFD}") and is measured as such. Pass false to immediately stop measuring input when an ill-formed sequence is encountered.

Methods.method_description: Returns the number of UTF-16 code units required for the given code unit sequence when transcoded to UTF-16, and a Boolean value indicating whether the sequence was found to contain only ASCII characters.
Methods.method_declar: static func transcodedLength<Input, Encoding>(of input: Input, decodedAs sourceEncoding: Encoding.Type, repairingIllFormedSequences: Bool) -> (count: Int, isASCII: Bool)? where Input : IteratorProtocol, Encoding : _UnicodeEncoding, Input.Element == Encoding.CodeUnit

return_description: The width of x when encoded in UTF-16, either 1 or 2.

Methods.method_description: Returns the number of code units required to encode the given Unicode scalar.
Methods.method_declar: static func width(_ x: Unicode.Scalar) -> Int
